summary: James Lerer Wolf was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) from at least December 1976 to January 1979. Payroll records and certifications detail his appointments, salary adjustments, and title changes within the committee. These documents provide a timeline of his employment, showing his presence on the HSCA payroll during various accounting periods. The documents consistently list him among other committee staff, indicating his role as a staff member during the HSCA's investigation.
significance: James Lerer Wolf's significance lies in his employment within the HSCA, contributing to the investigation of the JFK assassination. The payroll records and certifications document his role as a staff member, providing insight into the operational structure and personnel involved in the committee's work.
